page.description: The SQL::UpdateStatement object encapsulates the parsing and properties of a SQL UPDATE statement. as a result, it has the most properties. Its children are the various clauses that make up a complete UPDATE statement.

section.title: Example
section.description: Note that the fields to update and the corresponding value are specified in a comma delimited list of name/value pairs.
section.example: dim conn as SQL::Connection dim upd as SQL::UpdateStatement dim cs as SQL::CallResult dim connString as C dim sql_update as C connString = "{A5API='Access', FileName='c:\program files\a5v7\mdbfiles\alphasports.mdb'}" sql_update = "update customer set bill_city = 'Phoenix', bill_postal_code = '08000', bill_state_region = 'AZ' where customer_id = 1" if .not. conn.open(connString) then end end if if .not. upd.parse(sql_update) then ui_msg_box("Error", upd.callresult.text) end end if if .not. upd.execute(conn) then end end if cs = upd.CallResult ui_msg_box("Call result", cs.Text)

property.name: Arguments
property.description: Read Only. Arguments for the current query.

property.name: ColumnReferences
property.description: Read Only. An array of all column references in the query (including nested occurrences). Behaves the same way as .SelectTableReferences.

property.name: ErrorColumn
property.description: Read Only. The column number of the last error reported by the parser.

property.name: ErrorText
property.description: Read Only. The text of the last parser error reported.

property.name: FunctionReferences
property.description: Read Only. An array of all function calls. Behaves the same way as .SelectTableReferences.

property.name: ObjectDefinitions
property.description: Read Only. For internal debugging. Returns a string description of the mapping between the ANTLR grammar and the Xbasic objects.

property.name: ParseTree
property.description: Read Only. For internal debugging. A string description of the underlying parse tree.

property.name: Set
property.description: Read Write. Column = Value objects (SQL::Query::Assignment) to be used in setting values.

property.name: SelectTableReferences
property.description: Read Only. An array of all table references in the from clause and those joined to them. This array is created when the property is requested, but can become out of date. Use the Resynch()function on any variable holding this list when any changes are made.

property.name: SQLStatement
property.description: Read Write. A variable that can be assigned a syntax string without parsing it. If no value is passed to the ::Parse()method, this value is used.

property.name: Table
property.description: Read Write. The table to be inserted into.

property.name: Where
property.description: Read Write. An expression for the WHERE clause.

property.name: XML
property.description: Read Write. Creates XML from the tree or recreates the tree from the XML.

methodref.name: Execute
methodref.description: Accepts an optional SQL::Connection object or connection string and executes the current SELECT statement on that or its current connection.

methodref.name: GenerateNativeSyntax
methodref.description: Accepts an optional SQL::Connection object or connection string and executes the current SELECT statement on that or its current connection. Returns the string that the ::Execute()or ::Validate()methods would pass to the connection. Note: This string is target syntax specific.

methodref.name: Parse
methodref.description: Accepts an optional text string and parses it. If the parse is successful, the elements of the SQL statement will be available immediately as Properties of the object.

methodref.name: Reset
methodref.description: Reinitializes the object as if it had just been declared.

methodref.name: Validate
methodref.description: Accepts an optional SQL::Connection object or connection string and validates the current SELECT statement on the connection that is passed or the current connection.
